page.title: 17The Farm Museum-Laughton
page.content: We talked to Mr. Barrett, our headteacher about the farm museum. Our first question asked how the museum had started. He said that many people in the area had thought that a farm museum was a good idea. He also said that in South Yorkshire we have a lot of naughty boys who instead of going to prison do jobs on Saturdays and Sundays. Instead of having fun they have to work. The Farm Museum Committee gave them a threshing machine to smarten up. They did that and made a good job of it. Mr. Barrett had some more farm machinery, like ploughs, and the boys were made to smarten them up too.
